titleStmt.title: Letter from Eartha M. M. White to Mrs. Young. March 4, 1910.
titleStmt.author: Eartha M. M. White

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author responds to Mrs. Young's request for advice.

objectDesc.p: A handwritten letter of three pages to Mrs. Young from White, written on 3/4/1910. The third page contains White's address and a sizeable hole in the middle of the sheet of paper.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

body.p:
I am indeed
sorry to hear of your family
trouble and my advice
would be to you as you
and Mr. Young are husband
and wife you should Keepkeep
your private affairs to your
selves. I did not send
for Mr. Young. The young men
who are in the quartet
met at my home and sent
for him to practice and
as he did not come they
sent for him. I always credited
you of being a woman of high
morals and having more common
sense. I hope you will

think this over and you will
see I am not to blame.
And as for asking me never to
Comecome or send to your home,
why, as I have never been
into your home. This request
will be easily granted.
Many thanks for your
advice as to getinggetting a husband
of my own. That is not a
easy thing to do matter
for husbands are few
and far between. When I
am ready there is one
in store for me without
giving any trouble.
As you and I are not
our Keeperskeepers and as time

is fleeting and life is so
short., Itit becomes me as a
Christian to tell that I
freely forgive you for for the
wrong you have done me
and I hope you will always
observe the secondSecond Commandment.
As for Castingcasting reflections on
my charity work., Thatthat is
GodsGod's work and he will
take care of that. If this
is a satisfactory reply please answer.
